image.altText: Joshua Brown in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: For more than a year, Jessica* worked in childcare alongside Joshua Dale Brown and trusted him to look after her own children.

title.children: This mum trusted Josh to look after her kids. Now he's facing child sex charges

image.altText: A blonde man in a tux speaks in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: As Australia tries to find its path through the uncertainty flowing out of Washington, it is important to understand that Donald Trump is not the only issue — or player — to be dealt with.

title.children: Amid global trade uncertainty, the PM has shifted his language on the US alliance

image.altText: A close up of Albanese with an Australian map behind him

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's speech comes at a delicate moment in Australia's key strategic relationship, with the federal government grappling with an unpredictable White House.

title.children: Albanese to champion 'Australian independence' within US alliance

image.altText: Jayden Seales raises his hand to celebrate as Australia batter Sam Konstas stands in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas chops on in the first over of the second innings and Usman Khawaja is trapped LBW after the West Indian tail takes them within 33 runs of Australia's total of 286 on day two of the second Test in Grenada. Follow live.

title.children: Australia sends out night watchman after openers out cheaply late on day two

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: KHAWAJA IS CAUGHT PLUMB IN FRONT!
KONSTAS IS OUT FOR A DUCK!
The West Indies' innings on 253 ends with another controversial call

image.altText: A man in white tennis clothes punches the air in celebration.

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson defeats Italy's Luciano Darderi to make it to Wimbledon's last 16 for the first time.

title.children: Thompson makes career history with gutsy win at Wimbledon

image.altText: A baby wombat in a blanket raises its paw in a way that makes it look like it's waving.

props.synopsis: Dianna Bisset finds a dead wombat on the side of the road, with a small bullet mark just behind its ear. In town, there's no mystery as to why this protected species is in the crosshairs.

title.children: Someone in NSW's tablelands is shooting perfectly healthy wombats. Locals know why

image.altText: Michael Long montage

props.synopsis: Star footballer, activist, reformist, leader: Michael Long has worn many labels in his 55 years. Now there's a new label to describe the Anmatjere and Marranunggu man from the Tiwi Islands.

title.children: Honours for the man who changed the AFL and fought for Indigenous rights

image.altText: Tadej Pogacar and Jonas Vingegaard talk

props.synopsis: As the 2025 Tour de France rolls out from Lille in France's north, all eyes will be on defending champion Tadej Pogačar, with two-time winner Jonas Vingegaard Hansen arguably the only rider in the way of total Tadej domination.

title.children: The two-way battle organisers hope will ignite the 2025 Tour de France

image.altText: Stacey appears in a grassy field in golden hour holding a stack of books she's written while gazing softly at the camera.

props.synopsis: From "enemies-to-lovers" to "slow burn", we've somehow got to the point where romance books are being marketed around tropes. We asked author and viral BookTokker Stacey McEwan to explain why we love them so much.

title.children: The best and worst romance book tropes according to viral author

image.altText: Illustration of a woman with long black hair from behind with handprints all over her body.

props.synopsis: Witnesses have recalled a painful past after an Indonesian minister questioned whether mass rape occurred during 1998 riots in Indonesia.

title.children: Indonesian government questions mass rape in 1998 riots

image.altText: Image shows a close-up view of a man's hand holding an electric vehicle charger and inserting it in the charging point.

props.synopsis: Political unrest in the Middle East highlights Australia's fuel insecurity, but electric cars powered by renewable energy could change that.

title.children: EVs could be key to cutting Australia's dependence on oil imports

image.altText: A women's tennis player throws her arms up in the air in celebration.

props.synopsis: Another seed topples out of Wimbledon after German Laura Siegemund defeated American Madison Keys.

title.children: German 37-year-old stuns Australian Open champ at Wimbledon

image.altText: Zaiden and Tiana Dyball smiling.

props.synopsis: The mother of a five-year-old with a rare genetic condition says her son risks losing his "incredible team of therapists" under changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: Mum fears son with rare condition risks being 'pushed out' over NDIS changes

image.altText: Vanessa Hudson stands in front of Qantas plane, holding a microphone

props.synopsis: Qantas boss Vanessa Hudson apologises to more than 6 million customers for a data breach, saying the airline takes cybersecurity "incredibly seriously".

title.children: Qantas CEO Vanessa Hudson finally fronts a camera, in Athens

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt hugs a woman wearing an orange floral shirt and holding white flowers

props.synopsis: Family and friends of Diogo Jota and André Silva gather to pay tribute to the brothers who died in a car crash.

title.children: Mourners arrive for Diogo Jota's wake in Liverpool forward's hometown

image.altText: Students dance in a circle at Dubbo College Senior Campus

props.synopsis: Dubbo College Senior Campus has the secret sauce to helping Indigenous students with a record number of Year 12 graduates.

title.children: Fixing the racist history in Australian education

image.altText: A boy in a blue shirt walks in front of damaged cars

props.synopsis: Waves of drone and missile attacks targeted Kyiv in the largest aerial attack since Russia's war in Ukraine began.

title.children: Russia hammers Kyiv in largest missile and drone barrage since war began

image.altText: Ben Shelton watches a tennis ball as it floats in the air in front of him at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Rinky Hijikata does not hit a single shot in a minute-long game on court to wrap up his straight-sets loss to American 10th seed Ben Shelton after their match was paused late on the previous day.

title.children: Australian star out of Wimbledon in a minute after overnight delay

image.altText: Blair Kinghorn poses with a rugby ball, sitting on wooden benches in a grandstand

props.synopsis: Preparing for their third match in Australia, the British and Irish Lions will unleash a Scot who could hold the key to success against the Wallabies.

title.children: Great Scot Kinghorn ready to make his mark on the Lions tour of Australia

image.altText: A man with a long black beard shakes hands with another man wearing a blue suit

props.synopsis: The Russian Foreign Ministry says the official recognition of the Afghan government will foster "productive bilateral cooperation".

title.children: Russia becomes first country to recognise Taliban government

image.altText: Donald Trump dances in front of a large American flag display.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's mega-bill blew up his bromance with his biggest billionaire backer and could end up costing him considerable political capital. But it also brings his MAGA priorities to life.

title.children: Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' will remake the US in three major ways

image.altText: A member of staff places the comic book titled 'The Future I saw' on a shelf.

props.synopsis: Japan has seen record numbers of visitors this year. But viral rumours of impending disaster stemming from a comic book prediction have reportedly impacted the tourism boom, with some airlines cancelling flights.

title.children: Decline in tourist numbers to Japan blamed on manga's disaster prediction

image.altText: Patrick Cripps walks off the field with the Carlton players

props.synopsis: Collingwood romps to a convincing win over Carlton at the MCG thanks to a second-half clinic, while GWS completes a big win over West Coast in Perth.

title.children: 'We let our club down tonight': Voss bemoans another horror night for Blues against Pies

image.altText: Brendan Piakura screams

props.synopsis: Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs missed the chance to go top of the NRL ladder with a breathtaking capitulation to surrender an 18-0 lead at the 60-minute mark to lose 22-18 against the Brisbane Broncos.

title.children: Broncos complete 'unbelievable' comeback to blow away Bulldogs

image.altText: A man working in a warehouse

props.synopsis: There are about 6,000 Australians who stand to lose $590 million invested with First Guardian following its collapse, as ASIC takes court action against its directors and promoters.

title.children: First Guardian collapse leaves thousands at risk of losing their super

image.altText: An external view of Moriah College

props.synopsis: School children have had eggs thrown at them, been chased down streets and subjected to Nazi salutes and death threats amid a surge of racism targeted at Sydney's Jewish community, a parliamentary inquiry hears.

title.children: Jewish children subject to 'relentless drip-feed of hate', inquiry told

image.altText: Julio César Chávez Jr punches Jake Paul with a right hook to the head

props.synopsis: Famed Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr is arrested in the United States just days after he fought influencer-turned-boxer Jake Paul in California.

title.children: ICE arrests Mexican boxer in US days after fight against Jake Paul

image.altText: A silhouette of a hand holds a mobile phone with a blank white screen

props.synopsis: I was transferring my mobile number to a new provider when my phone service cut out. That was my first clue that my identity had been stolen.

title.children: I was a victim of cybercrime. This is what I wished I'd paid attention to

image.altText: Five young women and a man stand together for a photo on a porch

props.synopsis: The man responsible for killing four Idaho university students has struck a plea deal with the prosecution — meaning some questions may never be answered.

title.children: Bryan Kohberger confessed to four murders — he may never have to explain why

image.altText: A woman applies sunscreen to her arm. A pool can be seen in the background.

props.synopsis: At least eight sunscreens that failed to meet their advertised SPF50 sun protection claims in a recent review had their original tests for certification done by an overseas laboratory whose results are being questioned by industry experts.

title.children: Eight sunscreens that failed their SPF claims tested by same overseas lab

image.altText: A middle-aged man gestures as he speaks near an industrial site.

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed more than $430 million to help bring large-scale hydrogen production to the New South Wales Hunter region.

title.children: Government doubles down on hydrogen hub amid uncertainty

image.altText: Jess Munday, Labor Candidate for Franklin 2025-07-04 10:07:00

props.synopsis: The Liberals have claimed Unions Tasmania secretary and Labor candidate Jess Munday is ineligible to be elected because of her position on the WorkCover Tasmania board. But Labor has released its own legal advice, prepared by a former solicitor-general, who found Ms Munday would not be ineligible.

title.children: Labor confident Jess Munday is eligible to contest election

image.altText: Usher, wearing a fur coat, sings into a microphone.

props.synopsis: US singer Usher had been due to play 12 arena dates in Sydney and Melbourne towards the end of the year.

title.children: R&B star Usher cancels Australian arena tour without explanation

image.altText: ADHD meds

props.synopsis: Some of the most common medications for ADHD are set to be in short supply until the end of the year, which means plenty of people across Australia may find their pharmacist can't fill their prescriptions.

title.children: Why ADHD meds are in short supply, and what can you do about it

image.altText: Oscar Piastri poses with a fan for a selfie photograph during a fan day

props.synopsis: Australia's Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says he believes any of the top four teams are in with a chance of victory at Silverstone this weekend.

title.children: Piastri expecting a 'good fight' with multiple drivers in Britain
